messages.title: Policies for People
messages.content: What a UKIP Government will do

keyPolicies.policyDescription: UKIP will repeal the Climate Change Act 2008 which costs the economy £18bn a year.
By leaving the EU, the UK will leave the Common Agricultural Policy. Outside the EU UKIP will institute a British Single Farm Payment for farms.
UKIP will protect the Green Belt. Planning rules in the NPPF will be changed to make it easier to build on brownfield sites.
UKIP will introduce the principle of MPs from devolved nations voting on English-only issues.
UKIP will target foreign aid at healthcare initiatives, inoculations against preventable diseases, clean water and aid with a British branding.
UKIP recognises the benefits of limited, controlled immigration.
UKIP opposes the Childcare Tax because it discriminates against homemakers who are unable to benefit from the tax system.
UKIP recognises and values an overarching, unifying British culture, which is open and inclusive to anyone who wishes to identify with Britain and British values.
UKIP will introduce personal allowance to the level of full-time minimum wage earnings (approx £13,500 by next election).

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Reducing debts we leave to our grandchildren
keyPolicies.policyDescription: UKIP will leave the EU and save at least £8bn pa in net contributions.
UKIP will withdraw from the jurisdiction of the European Court of Human Rights.
UKIP supports and seeks to stimulate the business ethos and the spirit of adventure.
UKIP will resource fully our military assets and personnel.
UKIP will ensure that GPs' surgeries are open at least once in the evening, Monday to Thursday.

issues.economy: UKIP will introduce personal allowance to the level of full-time minimum wage earnings. UKIP will review all legislation and regulations from the EU.
issues.education: UKIP will scrap the target of 50% of school leavers going to university. Students from the EU will pay the same student fees as international students.
issues.environment: UKIP will repeal the Climate Change Act 2008.
issues.governance: UKIP will introduce the principle of MPs from devolved nations voting on English-only issues.
issues.health: UKIP will ensure that GPs' surgeries are open at least once in the evening, Monday to Thursday.
issues.immigration: UKIP recognises the benefits of limited, controlled immigration.

housing.content: UKIP will protect the Green Belt. Planning rules in the NPPF will be changed to make it easier to build on brownfield sites.

images.caption: What a UKIP Government will do -- Policies for People
